citation.article-title: Bacillus horneckiae sp. nov., isolated from a spacecraft-assembly clean room
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Bacillus horneckiae sp. nov.

Bacillus horneckiae (hor.nec′ki.ae. N.L. gen. fem. n. horneckiae of Horneck, named after Dr Gerda Horneck, a German space microbiologist who carried out pioneering work in exposing spores to several space and radiation conditions).
Vegetative cells are rod-shaped, 1–1.5 μm in diameter and 4–6 μm long, motile and Gram-stain-positive and form endospores that are subterminal in position.
Grows under aerobic conditions only.
Catalase is produced.
Colonies formed after 24 h of growth on TSA at 32 °C are yellowish, plain, 3 mm in diameter, show no pigmentation and possess irregular edges.
Optimum growth temperature is 30 °C; known strains do not grow below 4 °C or at 50 °C.
Cells grow in the absence of NaCl and with up to 10 % (w/v) NaCl and up to pH 10.8 with optimum growth at pH 7.0.
Produces oval spores in MSM which are resistant to UV radiation up to 1000 J m−2.
Reduces nitrates to nitrites and hydrolyses gelatin.
Tests for oxidase, indole production, fermentation of glucose, arginine dihydrolase, urease, hydrolysis of aesculin and β-galactosidase (ONPG) are negative.
Assimilates the following as sole carbon sources: maltose, potassium gluconate, adipic acid, malic acid and trisodium citrate.
d-Glucose, l-arabinose, d-mannose, d-mannitol, N-acetylglucosamine, decanoic acid and 2-phenylacetic acid are not assimilated.

Acid is not produced from the following substrates: glycerol, erythritol, d- and l-arabinose, d-ribose, d-xylose, d-adonitol, methyl β-d-xylopyranoside, d-galactose, d-glucose, d-fructose, d-mannose, l-sorbose, l-rhamnose, dulcitol, inositol, d-mannitol, d-sorbitol, methyl α-d-mannopyranoside, methyl α-d-glucopyranoside, N-acetylglucosamine, amygdalin, arbutin, aesculin, salicin, cellobiose, maltose, lactose, melibiose, sucrose, trehalose, inulin, melezitose, raffinose, starch, glycogen, xylitol, gentiobiose, turanose, d-lyxose, d-tagatose, d- and l-fucose, d- and l-arabitol, gluconate, 2-ketogluconate and 5-ketogluconate.
Gelatin liquefaction is positive for strains 1P01SCT and 1P02SA and weakly positive for three other strains.
The major fatty acid of strains 1P01SCT and 1P08SA is iso-C15 : 0.
The diagnostic diamino acid in the peptidoglycan is meso-DAP.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 35.6±0.5 mol%.
The type strain, 1P01SCT (=NRRL B-59162T =MTCC 9535T), was isolated from surfaces of the PHSF located at the Kennedy Space Center, where the Phoenix spacecraft was assembled.
Strains 1P08SA (=MTCC 9536), 1P10SC, 1P10SE and 1P02SA are additional strains of the species, isolated from the same source.
